pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.2: At this time Venerable Udāyī knew that the Master had prohibited sitting alone with a woman on a private and concealed seat suitable for doing it, and so instead he sat alone in private with the same girl. When they were able, they just chatted; otherwise he gave her a teaching.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.3: A second time Visākhā had been invited to that family.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.4: When she arrived, she saw Udāyī sitting alone in private with the same girl,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.6: “Venerable, it’s not appropriate that you should sit alone with a woman on a private seat.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.7: Although you may not be aiming at that act, people with little confidence are hard to convince.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.9: After leaving, Visākhā told the monks about what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.12: “How can Venerable Udāyī sit alone with a woman on a private seat?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.13: After rebuking Udāyī in many ways, they told the Master …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.14: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you sat alone with a woman on a private seat?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.17: Foolish man, how can you sit alone with a woman on a private seat?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.18: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.19: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.20: ‘Although a seat is not concealed, nor suitable for doing it, it may be suitable for speaking lewdly to a woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.21: If a monk sits alone with a woman in private on such a seat, and a trustworthy female lay follower sees him and accuses him of
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.22: an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.23: then, if he admits to the sitting, he is be dealt with
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.24: according to one of these two
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:1.25: or according to what that trustworthy female lay follower has said.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.1: Although a seat is not concealed:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.2: it is not concealed by a wall, a screen, a door, a screening cloth, a tree, a pillar, a grain container, or anything else.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.4: one is not able to have sexual intercourse.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.5: It may be suitable for speaking lewdly to a woman:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.6: one is able to speak lewdly to a woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.10: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Order through a procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is unchallengeable and fit to stand—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.11: this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.15: a human female, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.16: She understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is lewd and what is not lewd.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.20: just the monk and the woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.22: there is private to the eye and there is private to the ear.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.24: one is unable to see them winking, raising an eyebrow, or nodding.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.26: one is unable to hear ordinary speech.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.28: the monk sits down or lies down next to the seated woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.29: The woman sits down or lies down next to the seated monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.30: Both are seated or both are lying down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.32: she has attained the fruit, she has broken through, she has understood the Teaching.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.1.34: she has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.1: Accuses him of an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.2: then, if he admits to the sitting, he is be dealt with
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.3: according to one of these two
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.4: or according to what that trustworthy female lay follower has said:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.6: “I’ve seen you seated, making physical contact with a woman,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.7: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.9: “I’ve seen you seated, making physical contact with a woman,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.11: “It’s true that I was seated, but I didn’t make physical contact,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.12: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.14: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.16: then he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.18: “I’ve seen you lying down, making physical contact with a woman,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.19: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.20: “It’s true that I was lying down, but I didn’t make physical contact,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.21: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.23: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.25: then he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.27: “I’ve heard you speaking lewdly to a woman while seated,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.28: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.30: “I’ve heard you speaking lewdly to a woman while seated,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.32: “It’s true that I was seated, but I didn’t speak lewdly,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.33: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.35: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.37: then he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.39: “I’ve heard you speaking lewdly to a woman while lying down,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.40: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.41: “It’s true that I was lying down, but I didn’t speak lewdly,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.42: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.44: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.46: then he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.48: “I’ve seen you seated alone with a woman in private,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.49: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.51: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.53: then he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.55: “I’ve seen you lying down alone with a woman in private,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.56: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.58: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.60: then he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.62: this is said with reference to the previous undetermined rule.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:2.2.65: It is either an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.1: If he admits to going, and he admits to sitting, and he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.2: If he admits to going, but he does not admit to sitting, yet he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.3: If he admits to going, and he admits to sitting, but he does not admit to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the sitting.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.4: If he admits to going, but he does not admit to sitting, nor does he admit to an offense, he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.5: If he does not admit to going, but he admits to sitting, and he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.6: If he does not admit to going, nor does he admit to sitting, but he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.7: If he does not admit to going, but he admits to sitting, yet he does not admit to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the sitting.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.8: If he does not admit to going, nor does he admit to sitting, nor does he admit to an offense, he is not to be dealt with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.9: The second undetermined rule is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.10: “Venerables, the two undetermined rules have been recited.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.11: In regard to this I ask you,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.23: The undetermined rules have been well laid down
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.24: By the Stable One, the Buddha who is the best.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay2:3.25: The chapter on undetermined rules is finished.
